intro: Psychotria fluctuans var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their pharmacological properties. Due to its habitat preferences and chemical composition, it is of interest in both botanical research and traditional medicine.
